content.question: Students measure the potential across a lightbulb and the current through it using the circuit shown above. The results are shown in the graph. Which of the following is supported by evidence from the graph?

choices.label: The brightness of the lightbulb is proportional to the square of the current.
The brightness of the lightbulb is not proportional to the square of the potential difference.
The resistance of the lightbulb for each data point can be determined by dividing the potential difference by the current.
The resistance of the lightbulb is not constant.

content.answer: The resistance of the lightbulb is not constant.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
